Heart surgeons are classified as a type of thoracic surgeon, or surgeons of the chest area. All thoracic surgeons undergo the same training, but some choose to specialize in the heart, blood vessels of the chest, lungs or other areas. According to the Profiles physician salary survey, cardiac and thoracic surgeons received median starting salaries of $360,000 annually in 2011. This is the third-highest starting pay, after orthopedic surgery of the spine, paying $465,000 the first year, and neurological surgery, paying $395,000. After six years of surgical practice, the average annual income of a cardiac or thoracic surgeon has increased to $522,875, according to the Profiles salary survey.

Cardiac surgeon salary in the USA. A Cardiac surgeon owns one of the highest paying jobs among surgeons. Typically a cardiac surgeon receives an annual salary of $82,976 – $525,132 in the US with average salary of $296,148 per annum. Cardiac surgeon’s salary differs from state to state. For instance, cardiac surgeons in New York earn an average yearly income of $60,402 to $477,158. Those who practice in California collect an average annual salary from between $57,674 to $489,357. Payscale noted that the average national salary of a cardiac surgeon in the US is from between $78,073 to $497,084 with total bonuses of up to 68,840 per year. The top earning Cardiac Surgeon can earn up to 525,132 yearly salaries. A Cardiac surgeon’s salary in the US varies according to number of years of experience.
